The Prime Minister read to the War Cabinet a telegramProposed (No. A.O.C. 225, dated the 4th September) received from the Airretaliation Officer Commanding, Middle East, stating that on the previouson Rome for evening a single enemy aircraft had dropped a few bombs atbombing of Abbassia Army Depot (between the city and! Heliopolis) and askingCairo. whether this action justified immediate retaliation on Rome.*The War Cabinet agreed (a) that the bombs having been aimed at military objectivessome miles out of Cairo itself, the incident was not sufficient to justify retaliatory action on Rome;(&) approved a reply in the sense of (a) above suggested by theChiefs of Staff.aircraft production.ProposedincreasedBomberProduction.(previous reference:W.M. (41) 83rdConclusions,Minute 1.)2. The Prime Minister said that he had invited the lord president of the Council to conduct an enquiry into the possibilityof improving the rate of bomber production. It would be necessaryfor other Departments to examine in what directions they could make sacrifices in order to enable the Ministry of Aircraft Produc-tion to increase the output.The War Cabinet took note of the above.U.S.S.R. -. 3.
